meanings.sent1: The thunder made a loud bo in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The drum produced a deep bo that echoed through the room.
meanings.sent3: The bo of the fireworks startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The bo of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The bo of the cannon could be heard for miles around.

meanings.definition: A command to stop or cease.
meanings.sent1: The teacher shouted a loud bo to get the students' attention.
meanings.sent2: The referee's bo ended the match abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The bo from the coach halted the players in their tracks.
meanings.sent4: The bo of the whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent5: The bo of the horn brought the traffic to a standstill.

meanings.definition: A type of shrub or tree.
meanings.sent1: The garden had a beautiful bo with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The park was filled with the sweet scent of the bo.
meanings.sent3: The bo in the backyard provided shade for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The bo in the forest stood tall and majestic.
meanings.sent5: The bo in the garden attracted many butterflies.

meanings.definition: A type of martial arts training weapon.
meanings.sent1: The student practiced with the bo to improve their skills.
meanings.sent2: The sensei demonstrated the proper use of the bo in class.
meanings.sent3: The bo was carefully crafted from strong wood for training.
meanings.sent4: The swift movements of the bo impressed the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The martial artist twirled the bo with precision and grace.
